title: How to Eat Small Portions During Meals

steps.title: Sipping water before a meal might help you feel full.
steps.content: Sipping water before a meal might help you feel full. Try drinking a 500 mL (17 fl oz) glass of water before digging into your meal. According to some studies, people actually ate smaller portions of food after drinking water. [2] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source It’s no magic trick—water fills up your tummy, so you don’t feel as hungry while you eat. [3] X Research source Generally speaking, experts suggest women drink 11½ cups (2.7 L) of water each day and men drink 15½ cups (3.7 L). [4] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: People who eat salad as a first course may eat smaller portions at lunch.
steps.content: People who eat salad as a first course may eat smaller portions at lunch. [5] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Similarly, people who sip on some soup before lunch may eat fewer calories during their main meal. [6] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Ultimately, a small appetizer like a salad or broth-based soup can help fight off any big hunger pangs, so you don’t eat as much in the long run. [7] X Trustworthy Source EatRight.org Organization associated with the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics providing advice about food, health, and fitness Go to source For reference, a serving of salad is about 1 cup (250 mL). Women should dish up a 1 1 ⁄ 2 c (350 mL) of soup, and men should dish up 2 c (470 mL). [8] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Smaller dishes and cutlery instantly shrink your serving size.
steps.content: Smaller dishes and cutlery instantly shrink your serving size. During a party, researchers gave the party-goers a big or small dish, as well as a big or small ice cream scooper. Overall, people who had bigger bowls and scoops ate more ice cream than the people with smaller dishes and scoops. This is because smaller dishes and serving utensils make it way easier to enjoy food in moderation. [9] X Research source For instance, you could grab the smallest dish available at a buffet, or eat dinner on smaller plates at home.

steps.title: Check the food label to see what the recommended portion size is.
steps.content: Check the food label to see what the recommended portion size is. When you eat directly out of the bag, it’s all too easy to lose track of how much you’ve actually eaten. Portioning your food helps you enjoy your favorite snacks without eating really big portions. [10] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source For example, you might pour some potato chips into a small dish instead of snacking directly from the bag. You might pour out a handful of your favorite candy instead of eating the whole package at once.

steps.title: Restaurant servings are notoriously big.
steps.content: Restaurant servings are notoriously big. Before digging into your dish, take a second to cut your entree into 2 portions. You could share your meal with a loved one, or ask your server for a doggie bag or to-go box so you can enjoy your leftovers later. Try to steer clear of larger portion options if the restaurant offers them. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Red pepper can lower your appetite for future meals.
steps.content: Red pepper can lower your appetite for future meals. In 1 study, researchers asked some participants to eat a non-spicy breakfast, and others to eat a breakfast made with red pepper. Believe it or not, people who ate the spicy breakfast had less of an appetite and didn’t eat as much during lunch. [12] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source You might add a dash of red pepper to your scrambled eggs, or sprinkle a little bit of pepper on your toast.

steps.title: You might not feel full right after you finish eating.
steps.content: You might not feel full right after you finish eating. Before getting another helping, take a breather for at least 10 minutes and see if you feel full afterward. It takes about 15 minutes for your body to tell your brain that you’re full, so you might not be as hungry as you originally thought! [13] X Research source

steps.title: Mindful eating helps you make careful, intentional decisions about your food portions.
steps.content: Mindful eating helps you make careful, intentional decisions about your food portions. Choose to eat when you’re hungry, but not starving—this way, you can appreciate your food instead of eating it really quickly. Then, dish out a small portion for yourself. Take a couple of minutes to think about the time and effort that went into making the meal. As you start eating, enjoy your food in small bites, taking time to chew carefully. [14] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source For instance, if you’re about to eat some spaghetti, think about the time it took to buy the spaghetti, cook the noodles, and prepare the sauce. Then, give a silent thanks for the chance to enjoy this delicious meal.

steps.title: Try to eat 5 servings of veggies and 4 servings of fruit each day.
steps.content: Try to eat 5 servings of veggies and 4 servings of fruit each day. A single serving of veggies is about 1 cup (36 g) of leafy greens, ½ cup (74.5 g) of chopped-up veggies, ½ cup (65 g) of cooked peas or beans, or 1 ⁄ 4 c (59 mL) of pure vegetable juice. One serving of fruit could be 1 medium-sized piece of fruit, 1 ⁄ 4 c (59 mL) of pure fruit juice, ¼ cup (40 g) of dried fruit, or ½ cup (59 g) of chopped-up fruit. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source For reference, a serving of veggies is about the size of a baseball, while a fruit serving is about the size of a tennis ball. [16] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Veggies are chock full of water and fiber, so they help you feel full and satisfied after a meal. [17] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source You could toss some chopped-up veggies in your morning omelet or slurp down a bowl of vegetable soup at lunch. You might even snack on carrots, bell peppers, green beans, and other tasty veggies when you get hungry. [18] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source You could whip up a fruit salad with your lunch and dinner, or snack on some dried fruit throughout the day.

steps.title: Protein helps you feel more satisfied and full after you eat.
steps.content: Protein helps you feel more satisfied and full after you eat. [19] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Try to eat about 1-2 servings of meat and poultry every day. Experts also recommend eating about 1 serving of nuts, beans, seeds, and legumes each day, and enjoying a serving of fish and seafood every other day. [20] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source A serving of lean protein resembles a deck of playing cards. [21] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source A serving of nut-based protein could be 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of peanut butter, 2 tbsp (17 g) of seeds or nuts, or ¼ cup (15 g) of cooked peas or beans. [22] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source Peanut butter, tuna fish, black beans, and salmon are all great sources of protein. [23] X Trustworthy Source EatRight.org Organization associated with the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics providing advice about food, health, and fitness Go to source

steps.title: Whole grains are way more filling than refined grains.
steps.content: Whole grains are way more filling than refined grains. Look for quick, easy replacements you can make in your favorite meals, like switching white rice with brown, or using whole-grain spaghetti instead of the regular kind. Since whole grains are more satisfying overall, you won’t have to eat as much. [24] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source A single serving of grains is the same size as a hockey puck. [25] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Health experts recommend eating around 6 servings of grain each day. [26] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source You might enjoy a slice of whole-grain toast for breakfast, or snack on a handful of whole-wheat crackers. If you like to bake, try using a little bit of whole-wheat flour instead of all-purpose flour.

steps.title: Dairy products help you feel less hungry and more satisfied.
steps.content: Dairy products help you feel less hungry and more satisfied. [27] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Try aiming for around 3 servings a day. About 1 cup (236.5 mL) of dairy is considered a serving—this might be 1 cup (236.5 mL) of skim milk, 1½ oz (28 g) of cheese, or 1 cup (236.5 mL) of low-fat yogurt. Stock up on your favorite dairy products for a delicious, satisfying snack. [28] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source You might enjoy some yogurt with your breakfast, or sip on a glass of milk at dinnertime.

steps.title: Try to limit yourself to around 3 servings each day.
steps.content: Try to limit yourself to around 3 servings each day. A serving of oils and fats could be 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of vegetable oil, 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of margarine, 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of low-fat salad dressing, or 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of low-fat mayonnaise. [29] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source A single serving will be around the same size as 2 playing dice put together. [30] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Opt for unsaturated fats, like olive and canola oil.

steps.title: Dietary fiber helps you feel full after you eat.
steps.content: Dietary fiber helps you feel full after you eat. Choose plenty of high-fiber foods for your meals and snacks, like whole grains, nuts, seeds, beans, fruits, and veggies. By eating more fiber, you can feel full more quickly, so your portions don’t have to be as big. [31] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Experts recommend that women up to age 50 eat 25 grams of fiber each day, while men up to age 50 eat 38 grams. Women over 50 should consume 21 grams, while men over 50 should consume 30. [32] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source You might eat a handful of sunflower seeds or mixed nuts as a snack, or enjoy nachos topped with beans for lunch.
